item.title: CAMEL-Bench: A Comprehensive Arabic LMM Benchmark
item.description: CAMEL-Bench is a new open-source benchmark for evaluating large multimodal models in Arabic. It addresses the lack of Arabic-centric LMM benchmarks by offering a diverse set of tasks across eight dom…..

item.title: CCI3.0-HQ: a large-scale Chinese dataset of high quality designed for pre-training large language models
item.description: The paper introduces CCI3.0-HQ, a large-scale, high-quality Chinese dataset for pre-training LLMs. Using a novel two-stage filtering pipeline, CCI3.0-HQ significantly outperforms existing Chinese dat…..

item.title: Data Scaling Laws in Imitation Learning for Robotic Manipulation
item.description: This paper explores data scaling laws in imitation learning for robotic manipulation. It finds that diverse data from many environments and object types is key to good generalization, following appro…..

item.title: DeCoRe: Decoding by Contrasting Retrieval Heads to Mitigate Hallucinations
item.description: To mitigate Large Language Model (LLM) hallucinations, DeCoRe contrasts outputs from a base LLM and one with masked retrieval heads (identified as crucial for factual recall), dynamically adjusting co…..

item.title: Distill Visual Chart Reasoning Ability from LLMs to MLLMs
item.description: Researchers created a new method called Code-as-Intermediary Translation (CIT) to improve multimodal large language models (MLLMs) understanding of charts. CIT uses code to translate visual charts int…..

item.title: Framer: Interactive Frame Interpolation

item.title: MotionCLR: Motion Generation and Training-free Editing via Understanding Attention Mechanisms
item.description: MotionCLR is a novel attention-based diffusion model for human motion generation and editing. It leverages self- and cross-attention mechanisms for fine-grained control, enabling various training-free…..

item.title: Robust Watermarking Using Generative Priors Against Image Editing: From Benchmarking to Advances

item.title: Should We Really Edit Language Models? On the Evaluation of Edited Language Models
item.description: This paper comprehensively evaluates various language model editing methods, finding that they generally cause performance degradation and safety issues, especially when scaling to many edits. Curren…..

item.title: Skywork-Reward: Bag of Tricks for Reward Modeling in LLMs
item.description: This paper presents Skywork-Reward, a novel reward model for LLMs. It emphasizes data quality over quantity, creating a smaller, meticulously curated dataset using advanced filtering and selection te…..

item.description: SMITE is a novel video segmentation method using a pre-trained text-to-image diffusion model with a tracking module and low-frequency regularization. It achieves temporally consistent segmentations w…..

item.description: Stable Consistency Tuning (SCT) improves consistency model training by reducing variance and discretization errors, leading to faster convergence and state-of-the-art image generation quality on CIFAR…..

item.title: Asynchronous RLHF: Faster and More Efficient Off-Policy RL for Language Models

item.title: DynamicCity: Large-Scale LiDAR Generation from Dynamic Scenes
item.description: DynamicCity is a new framework for generating large-scale, high-quality 4D LiDAR scenes from dynamic scenes. It uses a VAE to learn a compact 4D representation (HexPlane) and a DiT-based diffusion mod…..

item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) often hallucinate; knowledge editing aims to fix this without retraining. This paper introduces HalluEditBench, a new benchmark dataset that rigorously tests editing meth…..

item.description: Large language models (LLMs) surprisingly don’t utilize partial products for arithmetic, instead operating as symbolic learners. They solve arithmetic problems by decomposing them into manageable subg…..
